title: [fix](parquet) return error if schema changed in complex types
body:
## Proposed changes

Check the column type of complex type to prevent core dump in BE. `ColumnReader` will throw segmentation fault in the following case:
**Change complex types in hive:**
```
hive> create table struct_test(
           id int,
           sf struct<f1: int, f2: map<string, string>>) stored as parquet;

hive> insert into struct_test values
          (1, named_struct('f1', 1, 'f2', str_to_map('1:s2,2:s2'))),
          (2, named_struct('f1', 2, 'f2', str_to_map('k1:s3,k2:s4'))),
          (3, named_struct('f1', 3, 'f2', str_to_map('k1:s5,k2:s6')));

hive> alter table struct_test change sf sf struct<f1:int, f2: string>;
```

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

body:

Do not rely on external modification of `last_visit_time`, which is often forgotten.

title: [Enhance](multi-catalog) Use MetaIdMappingsLog to replace InitCatalogLog/InitDatabaseLog.
body:
## Proposed changes

A follow-up work for [pr-27666](https://github.com/apache/doris/pull/27666)

**Mainly has the following changes:**
* Mark `InitCatalogLog` and `InitDatabaseLog` as deprecated, use `MetaIdMappingsLog` for instead when initing external catalogs/databases.
* Remove the relevant logics for replaying `InitCatalogLog` and `InitDatabaseLog`.
* Remove annotations related to serialization on `ExternalDatabase`/`ExternalTable` and remove the `Writable`/ `GsonPostProcessable` interfaces for `ExternalDatabase`/`ExternalTable`.
* Remove `@SerializedName` on `idToDb` field for `ExternalCatalog`.
* Add logics for replaying `MetaIdMappingsLog` when the logs are generated by initing catalogs or databases.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

Issue Number: close #xxx

In order to monitor whether the cooled rowset has been thoroughly reclaimed, a new bvar has been introduced to track the count of all unused rowsets. This bvar may not be entirely accurate, as situations like push handlers can add unused rowsets too. However, it provides a rough indication of the reclamation status of cooled rowsets

body:
## Proposed changes

The `rowid_conversion` correctness check is designed for MOW table. 
Since we allow MOR table to create inverted index, we should add limitation for the check.

If it's MOR table, we do not allow it to do index compaction temporarily,  before we implement the `rowid_conversion` correctness check for MOR table.

title: [fix](routine-load) add lock to avoid editlog out of order when concurrent update job
body:
### Bug
When replay journal, FE meets NullPointerException and crash.
```
Operation Type 201
java.lang.NullPointerException: null at org.apache.doris.load.routineload.RoutineLoadManager.replayChangeRoutineLoadJob(RoutineLoadManager.java:726) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.doris.persist.EditLog.loadJournal(EditLog.java:669) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.doris.catalog.Env.replayJournal(Env.java:2513) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.doris.catalog.Env.transferToMaster(Env.java:1285) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.doris.catalog.Env.access$1200(Env.java:282) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.doris.catalog.Env$4.runOneCycle(Env.java:2429) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
        at org.apache.doris.common.util.Daemon.run(Daemon.java:116) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT] 
```
### Why this happened
It may cause the editLog out of order in the following scenarios:
thread A: create job and record job meta
thread B: change job state and persist in editlog according to meta
thread A: persist in editlog

which will cause the null pointer exception when replaying editLog

### How to solve this problem in this pr
Use the lock to make sure the record meta in memory and write editlog is atomicity, when pausing or stopping the job, these two states must be completed simultaneously when the job is visible.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by one committer.

repo.name: doris
repo.description: Apache Doris is an easy-to-use, high performance and unified analytics database.

title: [Improve](common)Optimize logging performance with LOG.isDebugEnabled()
body: In a logging system, when the log level is configured to not output logs of a certain level, by checking LOG.isDebugEnabled() before the log output statement, the overhead of string concatenation can be avoided. When performing string concatenation, even if the log level does not meet the output condition, the string concatenation operation will still be executed, which can lead to unnecessary performance overhead.

title: [enhance](mtmv)MTMV supports Hive multi-level partitioning
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

For example, the hive table is partitioned by `date` and `region`, with the following 6 partitions
```
20200101
        beijing
        shanghai
20200102
        beijing
        shanghai
20200103
        beijing
        shanghai
```

If the MTMV is partitioned by `date`, then the MTMV will have three partitions: 20200101, 202000102, 20200103

If the MTMV is partitioned by `region`, then the MTMV will have two partitions: beijing, shanghai


## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

body:
## Proposed changes

related to #31035 #31051

1. allow inverted index for key columns for MOR unique table
2. allow inverted index without parser for value columns for MOR unique table, and do not push down predicate if it may cause wrong result
3. disallow inverted index with parser for value columns for MOR unique table, due to MATCH without predicate push down is very slow.

title: [refactor](catalog) catalog interface refactor
body:
## Catalog Code Structure

Most of the code is located under the `org.apache.doris.datasource` package.

Relevant classes previously stored under `catalog.external` and `planner.external` have been moved to `datasource` package.
**No logic is changed**

Take JDBC Catalog as an example:

- `org.apache.doris.datasource.jdbc`
	- Store the implementation class of Catalog/Database/Table
	- Store classes related to metadata access, such as MetaCache
	- Store some public methods
- `org.apache.doris.datasource.jdbc.source`
	- Store classes related to data reading, such as JdbcScanNode
- `org.apache.doris.datasource.jdbc.sink`
	- Store classes related to data writing, such as JdbcTableSink

## How to implement a new Catalog（Read Only）

Let's say you have a new Catalog named "Foo".

### FE side

1. Implement `FooExternalCatalog` inherited from `ExternalCatalog` and implement the following methods:

	- `listDatabaseNames()`: Get a list of all Database names.
	- `listTableNames()`: Get a list of all Table names under the specified Database.
	- `tableExist()`: Determine whether the specified Table exists.
	- `initLocalObjectsImpl()`: used to initialize some necessary objects when creating Catalog, such as `JdbcClient`.

2. Implement `FooExternalDatabase`, which inherits from `ExternalDatabase`, and implements the following methods:

	- `getExternalTable()`: Construct `FooExternalTable` instance.

3. Implement `FooExternalTable` integrated from `ExternalTable` and implement the following methods:

	- `makeSureInitialized()`: Initialize some necessary objects, such as `JdbcTable`.
	- `initSchema()` returns the schema of the Table.

4. Implement `FooScanNode` inherited from `FileQueryScanNode` and implement the following methods:

	- `getSplits()`: Get the data `Split` that need to be scanned.
	- `doInitialize()`: Initialize some necessary objects.
	- `setScanParams()`: For each `Split` object, generate a `TTableFormatFileDesc` object passed to the BE side.
	- `getLocationType()`: Get the location type of the `Split` that needs to be scanned, such as S3/HDFS.
	- `getFileFormatType()`: Get the format type of `Split` to be scanned, such as Parquet/ORC.
	- `getFileCompressType()`: Get the compression type of `Split` to be scanned, such as LZ4/SNAPPY.
	- `getFileAttributes()`: Get the description attributes of the file, such as the row and column separators of Text format files, etc.
	- `getPathPartitionKeys()`: Get the column name of the partition column on the file path.
	- `getLocationProperties()`: Obtain the connection information necessary to access the data source, such as HDFS namenode address, authentication information, etc.

### BE side

See various implementations inherited from `GenericReader` under `be/src/vec/exec/format/`.

## TODO

This is the first step to ensure that most of the External Catalog-related code is under a unified package. The interface implementation will be further refined in the future.
